name: Seismic Processing
points: Improvement of subsurface imaging through conventional and spatial seismic attribute sampling
Structural and stratigraphic continuity at reservoir boundaries
Stratigraphic level delineation in the depth domain and image enhancement in reservoirs of interest
Calibration of well trajectories and areas of opportunity for exploration

name: Tectonic Deformation Model Studies
points: Deformation history in fractured reservoirs
Development of fracture models in YNF
Fracture models associated with hydrocarbon production control
Control of the Water-Oil contact level through understanding the fracture model

name: Petrophysical and Seismic Studies
points: Identification of vertical and horizontal reservoir structure boundaries through well geophysical logs
Determination of petrophysical models using subsurface petrophysical properties
Relationship of petrophysical and seismic models by combining subsurface physical properties
Determination and location of water-oil contact through well geophysical logs

name: Seismic Inversion Flow
points: Pre-stack seismic data analysis in the Gathers domain
Calibration of velocity models derived from RMS velocity picking and well velocities
Correlation and extraction of representative subsurface wavelets in specific reservoirs through geological and geophysical information
Determination of inversion seismic models oriented towards reservoir characterization

name: VCDSE Stages and Monitoring and Quality Control
points: Specialized technical personnel with knowledge and experience in each discipline, highly skilled in the management and operation of specialized software, as well as the ability to interact with different disciplines for efficient project operation
Structured methodology with organized sequences to ensure the good performance of project activities to meet objectives
State-of-the-art software, hardware, and methodologies applied to guarantee the best solutions and consequently reduce risk and uncertainty in those solutions
Ensuring quality processes in the review and validation of results, as well as meeting delivery times of those results, to optimize technical-financial activities for the project

name: Seismic Reflection Studies Applied to Geothermal Reservoir Characterization
points: The visualization of geological data in the 3D domain allows analysts and interpreters to understand the spatial relationships between different types of subsurface data, e.g., geological, geophysical, and well data
The results of 3D seismic will allow accurate mapping of the subsurface to locate the most favorable places for geothermal resource exploration
Examples of 3D seismic applied in: Bavaria-Germany (2019), Switzerland (September 2021)

name: Well Seismic Data Analysis
points: Seismic waves generated at a certain depth are recorded throughout the survey
Gathers resulting from the acquisition of Vertical Seismic Profile (VSP-Zero Offset) in wells
Selection of compressional wave velocity derived from the acquisition of cross-well tomography (Cross-Hole Seismic) for subsurface property characterization

name: Potential Methods Applied to Subsurface Characterization
description: Identification and visualization of specific anomalies to precisely determine their extent and configuration, i.e., characterizing their geometry for decision-making in exploration and subsurface studies
points: Resistivity
Velocity
Induced polarization
Magnetic susceptibility (terrestrial, aerial)
Gravimetric data

name: Time Domain Electromagnetic Studies (TEM)
points: Conductivity and/or resistivity contrasts in the subsurface
Characterization of subsurface flows in preferential orientations
Characterization of subsurface anomalies due to the detection of changes in Resistivity and/or Electrical Conductivity

name: EMDF Domain Electromagnetic Studies
points: Support in the construction of civil works: roads, railways, bridges, gates, dams
Subsurface studies: Location of cavities (cavernous zones), Location of faults and fractures, measurement of vadose zone thickness, saturated zone

name: Ground Penetrating Radar Studies
points: Specialized exploration applications with ground-penetrating radar (GPR)
Profiles obtained with the Ground Penetrating Radar technique (Detection of cavernous zones)
Conversion domain profiles, Amplitude - Depth (For detection of cavernous zones)

name: Aerial Magnetometry
points: Geothermal and Hydrocarbon Exploration: identification of geological structures conducive to hydrocarbon accumulation or evaluation of geothermal resources
Mineral exploration: detection and mapping of magnetically susceptible mineral deposits
Environmental and natural hazard monitoring: detection of weakness zones that pose risks to the environment or public safety
Groundwater studies: to understand the characteristics of aquifer systems based on the magnetic permeability of rocks
Monitoring of underground infrastructure: monitoring of buried pipelines and cables, as well as detecting possible leaks or structural anomalies
